Column Comment.0: GROUP INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: The valid sub type of the type ofinformation item that is the group. In many cases, this would be RM INFO ITEMDOCUMENT.
Column Comment.1: GROUP INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item thatrepresents a group or set of information, such as a well file.
Column Comment.2: INFORMATION ITEM SUBTYPE: the type of information item. May be one of Thevalid types of Information item as defined by check constraints.
Column Comment.3: INFORMATION ITEM ID: Unique identifier for the information item.
Column Comment.4: GROUP OBSERVATION NUMBER: Unique identifier for the group of informationitem objects, such as a unique identifier for a well file.
Column Comment.5: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.6: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.7: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.8: GROUP SEQUENCE NUMBER: Use this column to order objects inside aninformation item group, only for cases where order is important to your businessrules.
Column Comment.9: REFERENCE RECORDS MANAGEMENT INFORMATION ITEM GROUP TYPE:The type of information item group, such as a well file, that consists of a set ofdocuments or other products which together serve a useful business function. If youuse the Dublin Core terms, values would beconformsTo, hasFormat, hasPart,hasVersion, isFormatOf, isPartOf, isReferencedBy, isReplacedBy, isRequiredBy,isVersionOf, references, replaces, requires.
Column Comment.10: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.11: REMARK: Narrative remarks relating to this row of data.
Column Comment.12: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.13: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.14: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.15: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.16: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.17: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.18: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.19: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
